alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 5:52PM CDT until June 17 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: .Thunderstorms will torrential rainfall will continue a few more hours. This may produce rain amounts in a short period of time that will produce flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Lamar, Marion and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayette, Aliceville, Vernon, Sulligent, Gordo, Reform, Millport, Carrollton, Pickensville, Guin, Kennedy, Detroit, Belk, Beaverton, Ethelsville, Memphis, McMullen, Ashcraft Corner, Blooming Grove and Bedford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
